text.__SUMMARY__: Rhododendron ochraceum (峨马杜鹃) is a rhododendron species native to Chongqing (Nanchuan), southern Sichuan, and northeastern Yunnan, China, where it grows at altitudes of 1700–3000 meters. It is a shrub that typically grows to 2–6 meters in height, with leaves that are oblanceolate and 5–8.5 × 1.2–2.5 cm in size. Flowers are crimson.
text.References:
Rehder & E. H. Wilson in Sargent, Pl. Wilson. 1: 534. 1913.
The Plant List
